Name: AVM Mark Neal
Job/Team Function:
Defence is taking greater control of its technical and information architecture in order to develop more cost effective and flexible solutions to its operational and business needs. The Service Design Directorate generate three key effects:
• On behalf of the Defence Authority for Information, we set and assure Defence-wide strategy, policy, architectures and standards for information, information systems and the electro-magnetic spectrum. This framework aims to ensure interoperability, cost-effectiveness, security, legal compliance and appropriate supply of information professional skills.• On behalf of ISS as a whole, the Design Directorate captures customer needs and manages the supply of ISS solutions and services - ensuring that we reconcile customer needs with capacity and capability to best effect. We support transparent prioritisation by customers and work with customers from first contact to resolution.• We provide the vital expertise to design solutions to meet customer needs that make best use of existing services and, where they don't already exist, to design new and innovative services. As part of 'one ISS' we do this in an integrated way that supports the delivery and operation.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The ISS Service Operations, Customer Services, consists of two main business units, Ops Plans and Customer Services (CS).Ops Plans - A task organised Joint team, of Service Operations and Programmes Group staff which leads:- Joint operational C4ISR planning for military campaigns, contingent operations overseas and UK operations. The ISS Front Door for operational requirements. Programme management and delivery coherence of C4ISR to operations. Complex Project Management of C4ISR projects to operational theatres.Operational logistics and ISS Logistics Assurance. Application and architectural support to operations. Customer Services (CS) - part of the overarching ISS Front Door (with SPOC as the focal point for Users and Programmes group for sponsors). CS is responsible for managing key ISS Customer Service delivery, including:• Providing a personal contact point for ISS Customers to enable effective working relationships to be developed.• Providing ISS with an understanding of the construct and needs of its Customer base and individual Customers in order for ISS to deliver in line with Customer needs. • Communicating information on ISS delivery and developments via a variety of Customer-facing channels. • Capturing Customer requirements and requests for new and/or substantial changes to ISS services. 
• Managing significant change and complex projects on Defence sites. • Handling resolution of Customer issues and complaints. • Reporting performance of ISS service delivery and operations to Customers, to enable service improvements.
These services are discharged through Customer Managers who provide direct support to Customers at TLB and Site level, grouped into 3 Defence Regional Teams, and a central team (CS Integration) who co-ordinate engagement activity that cuts across these Regions.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The CTO is responsible for injecting innovation into the technology used by the UK armed forces and creating the technology strategy based on a common, base architecture, using COTS products as much as possible. This is being achieved by:
• Organisational transformation: creating an entirely new architecture practise and Design Authority for the MOD that will ensure coherence to a single architecture framework across all the armed forces (army, navy and air force) and deliver a common base and standardize architecture and by introducing design gate approvals. 
• HR Transformation: Re-skilling the technical teams and equipping them to address the challenge of creating designs rather than just assuring them.
• Challenging current technology direction: Setting the standard and creating a reference architecture against which vendors will be required to deliver solutions. This reference architecture works from the tactical edge to the HQ and will create a single information environment that can be delivered in a WAN, Satellite or narrow bandwidth radio environment. 
In addition, the CTO is working across the pillars (Design-Deliver-Run) to work with the ongoing SIAM transformation that to embed ITIL processes and tools across the organisation. This includes re-designing the SOC and NOC tools and processes to work across the forces.

Name: Maj Gen Stuart Skeates

Name: N/D
Job Title: ISS Head of Corporate and Management Information
Job/Team Function: The C&MI team forms part of the Service Design Directorate and is responsible for managing the ‘information layer’. It determines the policy for Knowledge and Information Management across Defence and supports the Departmental Records Officer. It also helps the Department to comply with statutory Information Rights legislation, including the Freedom of Information and Data Protection Acts. The team is tasked with driving improvements to Defence Management Information, in response to concerns raised by Lord Levene in his 2011 review. In addition, it is working to improve the Department’s digital capability, in line with the cross-Government drive that we should be ‘digital by default’.

It works closely with International Partners and Other Government Departments in related capability areas and technology domains.

Job Title: ISS Head of Defence as a Platform
Job/Team Function: Defence as a Platform (DaaP) is a unified approach looking at the delivery of services to ISS customers as opposed to the delivery of systems. The primary role of ISS is shifting from being an organisation that manages contracts to one that delivers all core platforms and the services that run over them, be they in the base or deployed space. There are three key elements to DaaP: Base, Deployed and Future and each one of these will have its own service performance and business alignment cell with a programme planning office and more.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The Head of Architecture works directly to the Director Service Design, as a core part of the leadership team, to deliver the transformation programme and lead ISS into a new era. In support of the CIO’s vision, Hd Architecture is the lead for implementing the overarching architecture across the ISS organisation and wider MOD. He is responsible for leading the programme to develop, maintain, and govern the enterprise architecture (EA) across the MOD, defining the EA process and architecture review process, and for leading the integration of those processes with related business and ICT processes. He also leads for the MOD the implementation of application architecture, information architecture, security architecture, and infrastructure technical architecture.
 The Head of Architecture works directly to the Director Service Design, as a core part of the leadership team, to deliver the transformation programme and lead ISS into a new era. In support of the CIO’s vision, Hd Architecture is the lead for implementing the overarching architecture across the ISS organisation and wider MOD. He is responsible for leading the programme to develop, maintain, and govern the enterprise architecture (EA) across the MOD, defining the EA process and architecture review process, and for leading the integration of those processes with related business and ICT processes. He also leads for the MOD the implementation of application architecture, information architecture, security architecture, and infrastructure technical architecture.

Name: Richard Holroyd
Job/Team Function: ISS Chief Operating Officer is accountable to MOD Chief Digital Information Officer DG for transformation, operations and business strategy.  Setting and driving the transformation of Defence's Information System and Services.

Name: Gen Sir Richard Barrons
Job/Team Function: To bring coherence to the delivery of joint effect by managing, delivering and championing joint capabilities to support success of military operations today, tomorrow and in the future.
